external_links ==mace_windu in the_starwars.com databankmace_windu on wookieepedia, a_star_wars wikidarth
bane is a_fictional_character in the_star_wars_franchise.
bane was created by george_lucas, within the_star_wars_canon where bane is first mentioned in the_novelization of star_wars:i – the_phantom_menace, where bane is an_ancient_sith_lord who lived a thousand years before the_films, and is known for being the_originator of the_"rule of two" that the_sith_lords follow, which establishes: "a_master and an_apprentice can be the_only_sith in the_galaxy at one_time", which still remains as bane backstory.
bane only on-screen appearance happens when bane appears as a_ghost to jedi_master_yoda in the_animated_series star_wars:
the_clone_wars, voiced by mark_hamill (who portrays luke_skywalker in the_films).in 2014, when lucasfilm officially rebranded the_star_wars expanded universe as star_wars_legends, and declared lucasfilm non-canon to the_franchise, all of bane_other_appearances, including the_comic_book_series jedi vs. sith and the_novels darth_bane: path of destruction, darth_bane: rule of two and darth_bane: dynasty of evil, ceased to be canon, leaving bane only_canonical_appearance the_cameo in star_wars:
the_clone_wars.
character_overview ==
in the_star_wars_universe, darth_bane is an_extremely_powerful_sith_lord who lived a_millennium before the_events of episode_i: the_phantom_menace.
the_character was created in the_script for episode_i and first mentioned in the_novelization of the_film.
in both_instances, the_character was established as the_originator of the_sith_"rule of two", which states: "a_master and an_apprentice can be the_only_sith in the_galaxy at one_time", before which the_sith_empire was structured like the_jedi but due to the_sith_empire shortfalls
the_character created the_rule of two_philosophy.
the_rule of two_philosophy is mentioned by yoda, but the_part where the_character mentioned darth_bane was cut from the_film.
the_rule of two_philosophy would aid palpatine in taking over the_galaxy a thousand years later in episode iii: revenge of the_sith.
appearances ==
television ===
star_wars:
the_clone_wars ====
in the_television_series star_wars: the_clone_wars_sixth_season, darth_bane appears as an_apparition to yoda on the_sith_home_planet_moraband.
darth_bane is voiced by mark_hamill, who portrayed luke_skywalker in the_films.
prior to taking on the_role of darth_bane, hamill did not know of the_character or how darth_bane fit into the_overall_arc of star_wars.
darth_bane son nathan knew about the_history of the_character, however, and was able to explain it to his_son nathan father once his_son nathan took on the_role.
for the_portrayal, dave_filoni recorded hamill reading dave_filoni lines using multiple_inflections, each portraying different_emotions, and then blended all together into the_version heard within the_episode.
previous to that_appearance, the_developers of the_show had considered and rejected for darth_bane to appear during the_third_season's_mortis_trilogy_arc alongside darth_revan, acting as an_influence on the_son (an_embodiment of the_dark_side).for now, this serves as bane's_only_canon_appearance.
legends ===
with the_2012_acquisition of lucasfilm by the_walt_disney_company, most of the_licensed_star_wars_novels and comics produced since the_originating_1977_film star_wars were rebranded as star_wars legends and declared non-canon to the_franchise in april 2014.==== path of destruction and jedi vs. sith ====
darth_bane_backstory is established in darth_bane: path of destruction by drew_karpyshyn.
darth_bane is born as dessel on the_planet_apatros, the_son of a_miner named hurst.
an_abusive_alcoholic, hurst blames the_boy for the_death of the_boy wife in childbirth, and often calls the_boy the "bane" of the_boy existence.
bane's_father takes the_boy into the_mines at a_young_age where the_boy is bullied and abused well into adulthood.
with the_boy_latent_affinity in the_dark_side of the_force, darth_bane subconsciously uses this_power to kill bane's_father in darth_bane sleep.
after darth_bane kills a_republic_navy_ensign in self-defense, darth_bane flees apatros to evade arrest, and joins the_armies of the_brotherhood of darkness, an_amassing of sith_lords and acolytes.
his_instinctive_use of the_force (which his initially believes to be a_myth) brings his to the_attention of the_sith_lord_kopecz.
dessel is sent to the_brotherhood's_academy on korriban to be trained in the_ways of the_dark_side.
dessel becomes a_star_pupil after killing another_student in cold_blood.
in particular, dessel attracts the_attention of sirak, the_top_student at the_brotherhood's_academy on korriban.
after bane realizes that bane had indeed killed bane father with the_dark_side, bane subconsciously retreats from the_force, losing bane power.
bane falls out of favor in the_brotherhood's_academy on korriban, and is eventually refused any_personalized_training.
months later, in a_vain_attempt to reestablish himself, bane challenges sirak to a_fight and is seriously injured in the_ensuing_duel.
bane's_training in and ascension to the_sith is detailed in both_path of destruction and jedi vs. the_sith.
as a_student, bane meets a_new_apprentice (and former_jedi) named githany, who secretly plans to use bane to bring down sirak.
githany reestablishes bane_connection to the_dark_side by showing bane in secret what the_sith_lords are teaching the_sith_lords.
most importantly, and to the_dismay of the_instructors, bane studies tomes from the_golden_age of the_sith.
bane soon realizes that the_brotherhood's_teachings are incomplete.
githany tells bane that bane intends to challenge sirak, assuming that bane would offer to assassinate bane to spare bane.
however, bane surprises bane by revealing bane intentions to destroy sirak personally in the_dueling_ring, and that bane had known all along bane was using bane.
during the_duel, bane seriously wounds bane opponent, but stops just short of killing bane.
qordis, the_main_sith there, knows of bane_secret_training with githany.
bane tells bane so, and ends up angering bane.
bane leaves the_academy, hoping to find the_secrets of ancient_sith_masters in the_valley of the_dark_lords on korriban.
to bane_disappointment, however, bane finds nothing.
bane returns to the_academy, where githany lures bane to the_archives, apparently intending to kill bane.
when the_trap comes to fruition, however, bane realizes that the_trap is actually meant for sirak.
githany kills sirak's_henchmen, and bane defeats and kills bane old nemesis in a_lightsaber_duel.
bane takes the_long-abandoned_sith_title of darth, leaves the_brotherhood, and travels to rakata_prime.
there, bane discovers a_sith_holocron left behind by darth_revan.
bane completes bane training, learning numerous_sith_techniques, including the_"thought_bomb" designed to kill all_force-sensitive_beings in reach.
bane sends this to lord_kaan.
bane then devises the_"rule of two": only_two_sith_lords, a_master and an_apprentice, are allowed to exist at one_time ("one to embody power and one to crave it.
orders that all of the_students on korriban be made into lords and brought to battle on ruusan.
lord_kaan sends kas'im to bring bane back to ruusan to join the_brotherhood on pain of death.
upon meeting bane_former_teacher, bane considers taking bane as an_apprentice, but ultimately kills bane after being refused.
afterwards, bane takes it upon bane to destroy the_remaining_sith and take on an_apprentice to carry on the_sith_legacy after bane.
bane sends a_staged_message to kaan asking to join the_brotherhood; githany_volunteers to kill bane.
unknown to githany, bane had also sent the_thought_bomb, supposedly as a_token of goodwill.
githany finds bane, and pretends to accept bane offer to join the_brotherhood.
githany slipped githany poison in a_kiss, and githany is rendered violently ill.
barely alive, bane eventually finds a_healer named caleb and extorts a_healer named caleb help by threatening a_healer named caleb daughter.
caleb cures bane of poison and nurses caleb
cures bane back to health.
bane returns to ruusan, where kaan agrees to follow bane lead in battle.
during meditation, bane uses bane own_body and power as a_focusing_agent to unleash a_wave of destruction upon the_forests of ruusan, where the_jedi's_army of light is hiding.
when the_other_sith_lords mutiny, bane orders the_commander of the_space_forces to engage the_jedi_fleet.
realizing he is facing defeat, kaan retreats to some_caves with the_other_sith_lords.
when the_thought_bomb detonates, the_thought_bomb destroys the_jedi_and_sith_armies, including kaan, githany, and the_leader of the_jedi_army of light, jedi_master_hoth.
in both_jedi vs. sith and the_end of path of destruction, bane meets a_force-sensitive_young_girl named rain, who had been brought to ruusan by the_jedi.
rain had been travelling with her_friend laa, a_native of ruusan, called a "bouncer", and had saved laa from being warped by the_sith_destruction to ruusan.
laa is shot dead by two_the_jedi_troops, because every_other_bouncer two_jedi_troops had encountered after the_destruction caused by bane and the_other_sith had been driven mad.
as bane watches, rain unintentionally draws on the_dark_side out of anger and kills the_two_jedi_soldiers.
bane realizes rain's_potential, and accepts bane as bane apprentice, darth_zannah.
bane: rule of two ====
in bane: rule of two, bane goes to onderon's_moon, dxun, to scavenge an_ancient_sith_temple.
bane leaves zannah with zannah first_mission: to find zannah way to onderon in 10_days by zannah own cunning and strategy.
bane finds bane objective: freedon nadd's holocron.
during the_quest, however, parasites called orbalisks cover his body.his uses the_holocron to gain further_knowledge of the_dark_side, as well as information on the_orbalisks.his learns that nadd faced the_same_problem with the_orbalisks, so the_dark_lord before his created a_suit that would stop them growing on his_face, hands and feet.
meanwhile, his_apprentice sabotages a_republic_craft and lands in an_unknown_strip of land which belongs to dxun's_infamous_beast_riders.
she nearly dies in the_attempt, but bane saves she.
then, the_pair goes into hiding on ambria, establishing illegal_contacts through the_galaxy through the_use of an_information_broker.
over the_next_decade, zannah acts as bane's_lieutenant, carrying out bane's_lieutenant orders as she grows stronger in the_dark_side.
bane's_lieutenant_orders
she to coerce secession_movements to move against the_republic too early; the_secessionists are subsequently crushed, both removing threats to the_sith's_power and deflecting attention off of the_two_sith_lords.
after a_botched_assassination_attempt against the_chancellor, zannah discovers a_dark_side_user, hetton, who has uncovered the_location of a_tomb of an_ancient_sith on the_deep_core_planet of tython.
it is rumored that a_tomb of an_ancient_sith on the_deep_core_planet of tython contains a_holocron with the_key that bane needs to produce bane own.
after killing the_pseudo_sith, bane and zannah set off on bane and zannah respective  missions: to recover the_ancient_holocron, and infiltrate the_jedi_archives for information on removing the_orbalisks.
upon arrival on tython and entering the_tomb, bane is attacked by scores of technobeasts, creations of the_ancient_sith to guard bane crypt.
bane eventually defeats her_crypt and successfully recovers the_ancient_holocron.
zannah is able to obtain the_information zannah needs, but zannah cover is blown at the_last_minute by zannah cousin tomcat, now_a_healer in the_care of the_jedi.
realizing zannah will need bane to remove the_orbalisks, zannah takes bane hostage and heads for tython, with the_the_jedi on hostage_and_heads_trail.
once zannah and tomcat arrive on tython and warn bane, zannah and tomcat retreat to the_interior of the_temple, waiting for the_attack.
when the_attack finally comes, the_two_sides are evenly matched, despite the_ancient_sith being outnumbered.
when bane is about to unleash an_attack on the_jedithe_jedi, bane opponent suspends a_force_shield around bane.
the_lightning bounces off the_interior of a_force_shield and cooks bane alive for seconds, melting bane flesh and causing the_orbalisk to burrow further into his_flesh, resulting in unbearable_pain.
bane blacks out and is almost killed by the_jedi, but zannah saves bane_master and brings bane to ambria, dragging tomcat along.
once there, tomcat (aka_darovit) creates an_agreement between zannah and caleb (the_healer who helped bane in the_previous_novel) designed to ensure their_survival.
caleb heals bane under the_assurance that bane will be arrested and imprisoned by the_jedi_council long before bane is strong enough to fight back.
tomcat (aka_darovit) then sends a_message_drone containing their_location's_coordinates to the_jedi.
also, the_jedi disables their_ship to ensure that the_sith cannot escape.
after several_days, bane awakens, infuriated when bane hears that bane apprentice has sent a_message alerting the_jedi the_jedi to their_presence.
begging their_location to kill bane, bane over-exerts bane and passes out again.
zannah kills caleb and disables tomcat (aka_darovit) with a_sith_spell of madness.their_location then hides their_location and their_location master in a_secret_compartment under caleb's bed.
when the_jedi arrive, tomcat (aka_darovit) attacks them in the_jedi delusional state, and the_jedi is killed.
finding no_other_living_beings, the_jedi the_jedi assume the_jedi have finally killed the last of the_sith.
zannah nurses bane back to health — even as bane pledges to kill him when bane training is complete —and they go back into hiding.
darth_bane: dynasty of evil ====
ten years later, darth_bane and zannah are living on ciutric_iv, disguised as merchants.
darth_bane is growing older and weaker, but zannah has not yet made any_attempt to confront darth_bane.
fearing that darth_bane is too weak to pursue darth_bane legacy, darth_bane starts to search for the_lost_knowledge of darth_andeddu, a_dark_lord of the_sith who harbored the_secret of eternal_life.
when darth_bane discovers that a_clue to the_secret can be found on the_planet_prakith, darth_bane distracts zannah by sending zannah to doan to investigate the_death of a_jedi_knight.
zannah knows that, despite zannah frail appearance, darth_bane is tremendously powerful and that zannah frailty might be a_trap to lure zannah into attacking zannah.
zannah also knows that, if zannah was to defeat darth_bane and take on the_mantle of the_dark_lord of the_sith, zannah would need an_apprentice of zannah own.
during zannah_investigations on doan, zannah meets a_dark_jedi named set harth who collects sith_artifacts.
after a_brief_duel, which set loses, zannah takes a_dark_jedi named set harth who collects sith_artifacts on as zannah apprentice.
meanwhile, bane arrives on prakith through a_series of hazardous micro-jumps into the_deep_core.
bane storms andeddu's temple, which is inhabited by a_cult called the malevolence, and easily recovers the_dark_lord's_holocron.
on the_trip back, bane is frustrated by the_holocron's_gatekeeper's_stalling and forcefully uses bane power to "hack" the_holocron, discovering darth_andeddu's_technique of essence_transfer, the ability to transfer one's_consciousness into another's_body.
armed with this_knowledge, bane returns to ciutric_iv expecting to confront zannah.
during these_course of events, serra, princess of doan, discovers that her_father has been killed and suspects bane's_survival.her hires an_assassin known as the_huntress to capture bane.
on ciutric_iv, the_huntress and a_group of mercenaries ambushes bane, and manages to incapacitate bane by a_potent_nerve_poison supplied by serra's_healer_knowledge.
while in captivity in the_stone_prison on doan, bane is tortured by serra as revenge for the_death of her_father.
however, serra's_bodyguard and best_friend, lucia, recognizes bane as des, commander of the_gloom_walkers who saved her squad multiple times during the_sith_wars.
lucia secretly counteracts the_poison restraining bane, and bane successfully breaks out.
however, bane also senses that zannah had tracked bane to doan and attempts to elude because of bane weakened state.
bane runs into lucia, but their_reunion is cut short when zannah arrives and engages bane in a_duel.
lucia is killed as collateral_damage.
despite being weakened and unarmed, bane is able to hold bane own against zannah.
serra is initially hesitant about activating the_self-destruct_system for the_prison, but upon discovering lucia's_death, lucia promptly activates the_self-destruct_system for the_prison.
bane manages to escape from zannah, and each_attempt to escape on different_shuttles.
prior_to_this,_set, who accompanied zannah, tracks down the_aura of darth_andeddu's_holocron among bane's_confiscated_possessions.
bane attempts to escape, but bane is waylaid by the_huntress in the_shuttle_bay.
bane manages to evade lucia and escape on a_shuttle.the_huntress the_huntress then encounters bane, and pledges to become the_huntress next_apprentice, offering the_huntress back the_huntress lightsaber and holocron which lucia stole from the_huntress estate.
bane and the_huntress, now renamed darth_cognus, follows serra back to ambria near caleb's_cottage.
the_princess, who has now learned to let go of bane_hatred, calmly awaits bane and allows cognus to kill bane.
bane then sends a_message to zannah directing bane to ambria to finish their_duel.
zannah arrives and their restart their_duel, with bane now armed.
zannah now knows that zannah cannot best bane in combat, so zannah resolves to utilize zannah specialty of sith_sorcery.
their_fight progresses with bane pressuring zannah until zannah unleashes a_mind_attack.
bane powers through bane_illusions, but zannah reveals bane_trump_card and summons sentient_tentacles of pure_dark_side_energy.
bane evades them and rushes zannah, but bane final blow is cut short by a_tentacle severing the_arm holding bane lightsaber.
as a_last_resort, bane invokes darth_andeddu's_essence_transfer_technique to possess zannah.
bane_body is destroyed as a_side_effect of darth_andeddu's_essence_transfer_technique and the two fight a_battle of wills within zannah's_body.
the_fight ends and the_fight is unclear who is the_victor.
zannah proclaims : "darth_bane is gone.
i am darth_zannah, dark_lord of the_sith and your_new_master".
cognus approaches zannah and proclaims her_loyalty to the_new_sith_master, as her_apprentice.
still, cognus cannot help but notice as zannah speaks her was continually clenching and unclenching the_fingers of her_left_hand.
bane's_method of halting the_tremors that plagued bane_old_body.
bane's_essence remains.
in some_unknown_place, set has activated darth_andeddu's_holocron and plans to obtain immortality.
legacy ====
bane is also featured in star_wars: legacy and legacy:
shards, set 130 years after return of the_jedi.
in "shards", darth_bane appears with two_other_long-dead_sith_lords, darth_nihilus and darth_andeddu, in a_vision to the_series'_chief_villain, darth_krayt.
darth_bane condemns krayt for taking more_than_one_apprentice, and prophesies that krayt's new sith empire will collapse when krayt's new sith empire followers turn on his_followers, since krayt's new sith empire "one sith" philosophy isn't an_improvement on the_rule of two.

external_links ==darth_bane in the starwars.com databankdarth_bane on wookieepedia,
a_star_wars_wikicount_dooku is a_fictional_character in the_star_wars_franchise, created by george_lucas.
one of the_main_antagonists of the_star_wars_prequel_trilogy, a_star_wars_wikicount_dooku appears in both_episode_ii – attack of the_clones (2002) and episode_iii – revenge of the_sith (2005), played by christopher_lee, as well as associated_media, such as books, comics, television_series, and video_games.a_fictional_character in the_star_wars_franchise, created by george_lucas is voiced by corey_burton in animated_series_star_wars: clone_wars (2003-2005) and the clone_wars (2008-2020), while christopher_lee reprised the_role in the_2008_animated_film that launched the_latter_series.
in the_star_wars_universe, a_star_wars_wikicount_dooku is the_ruler of a_star_wars_wikicount_dooku home planet of serenno, a_political_enthusiast, and a_former_jedi_master, who was trained by yoda and mentored qui-gon_jinn.
after becoming disillusioned with the_corruption within the_galactic_republic's_senate and losing his_faith in the_jedi_order, his eventually falls to the_dark_side of the_force and becomes darth_sidious'_second_apprentice after darth_maul, as the_sith_lord_darth_tyranus.
dooku plays a_pivotal_role in sidious'_rise to power, leading the_confederacy of independent_systems, made up of numerous_planetary_systems seeking independence from the_republic, throughout the_clone_wars, and engineering the_creation of the_clone_army used by the_republic in their_conflict with the_separatist_alliance.
although dooku hopes this will allow dooku to rule the_galaxy alongside sidious, whom dooku secretly plots to overthrow, dooku is ultimately betrayed by dooku master, who arranges dooku death at the_hands of dooku eventual replacement, anakin_skywalker.
count_dooku's_character and christopher_lee's_portrayal in the_prequel_films were met with generally_positive_reviews.
dooku has been highlighted as one of the_greatest_star_wars_villains of all_time, and a_foil for anakin_skywalker, whose_transformation into darth_vader is foreshadowed through dooku's own fall to the_dark_side.
count_dooku's_character and christopher_lee's_portrayal in the_prequel_films has also become very popular among the_star_wars_fanbase, gaining a_cult_following.
portrayal ==
dooku_dooku was portrayed by sir_christopher_lee in attack of the_clones and revenge of the_sith, while kyle_rowling performed the_lightsaber_action_sequences.
sir_christopher_lee also voiced count_dooku's_character and christopher_lee's_portrayal in the_prequel_films, but was replaced by corey_burton in the_subsequent_tv_series.
corey_burton had previously voiced dooku in the_2003_micro-series_star_wars: clone_wars, and went on to voice corey_burton in most of corey_burton video game appearances; most recently, star wars: battlefront_ii (2017).appearances ==
attack of the_clones ====
dooku_dooku is introduced star_wars: episode_ii – attack of the_clones as a_former_jedi_master who abandoned the_order after losing faith in their_traditions and the_jedi_council's_judgement.
dooku is also the_leader of the_confederacy of independent_systems, a_federation of planetary_systems rebelling against the_galactic_republic.
dooku says that the_galactic_republic is corrupt, and that the_galactic_republic politicians are more interested in maintaining the_bureaucracy and enriching its_politicians than in helping poor,_oppressed_systems.
dooku recruits bounty_hunter_jango_fett (temuera_morrison) to assassinate padmé_amidala (natalie_portman) on coruscant; the_attempt on padmé_amidala (natalie_portman) life fails, however.
when a_fight with obi-wan_kenobi (ewan_mcgregor) forces fett to flee from kamino to geonosis, the_bounty_hunter_rendezvous with a_fight with obi-wan_kenobi (ewan_mcgregor) benefactor.
after capturing obi-wan on geonosis, dooku tells dooku that dooku is attempting to save the_republic, explaining that thousands of senators are under the_influence of a_sith_lord named darth sidious.
when obi-wan refuses to join obi-wan, dooku reminds obi-wan of obi-wan late master,
qui-gon_jinn, who was dooku's_apprentice and shared many of obi-wan_views on politics_and_jedi_traditions.
padmé and obi-wan's_padawan_anakin_skywalker (hayden_christensen) later travel to geonosis to save obi-wan, but are also captured, and all three are promptly sentenced to death.
a_jedi_strike_team eventually arrives on the_planet to rescue the_trio, and a_jedi_strike_team are soon joined by the_republic's_new_clone_army, resulting in a_large-scale_battle between the_republic_and_separatist_forces.
dooku tries to flee, but obi-wan and anakin follow him  and engage him in a_lightsaber_duel.
dooku subdues anakin with a_blast of force_lightning and woundsobi-wan with woundsobi-wan_lightsaber.
when anakin comes to obi-wan_defense, dooku cuts off the_young_padawan's_arm.
just as dooku is about to escape, his_old_jedi_master, yoda (frank_oz), arrives and duels his.
unable to match yoda's_speed and agility, dooku distracts dooku by using the_force to dislodge a_large_pillar and send the_force hurtling toward anakin and obi-wan.
while yoda is busy saving them, dooku escapes.
after dooku arrives on coruscant, dooku shows the_geonosian_designs of the_death_star to sidious and informs dooku master that their_plan is working: "the_war has begun.
"revenge of the_sith
in the_opening of star_wars: episode_iii – revenge of the_sith, set three years later, dooku and separatist_commander general_grievous (matthew_wood) have kidnapped supreme_chancellor_palpatine (ian_mcdiarmid) — sidious'_alter_ego— as part of a_plan orchestrated by palpatine to lure anakin to the_dark_side of the_force.
anakin and obi-wan_board_grievous'_ship_and_confront_dooku, who knocks obi-wan unconscious, leaving anakin to face the_sith_lord alone.
anakin gives in to anakin hatred of dooku and uses the_dark_side to overpower anakin, severing both of dooku's hands and leaving anakin helpless.
palpatine then tells anakin to execute dooku on the_spot; after initial_hesitation, anakin brutally decapitates dooku.
this_act sets off a_chain of events that leads to anakin's_eventual_fall to the_dark_side and transformation into darth_vader, thus succeeding dooku as sidious'_third_apprentice and accomplishing what dooku couldn't: helping sidious' eliminate the_jedi_order and form the_galactic_empire.
the_clone_wars (film) ====
in the_2008_cgi_film_star_wars:
the_clone_wars,_count_dooku_plots to bring jabba the_hutt into the_folds of the_confederacy by enlisting jabba's uncle ziro the_hutt to kidnap jabba's son rotta.
after ziro's_agents deliver the_huttlet to the_planet_teth, dooku contacts ziro again to arrange for dooku minion asajj ventress
(voiced by nika_futterman) to take custody of rotta.
when jabba requests jedi_assistance to rescue jedi_son, dooku plans to frame jedi for the_crime.
dooku duels anakin (voiced by matt_lanter) for the_first_time since dooku duels anakin encounter in attack of the_clones.
the_duel ends in a_draw, and anakin_and_anakin_padawan_ahsoka_tano (ashley_eckstein) eventually foil dooku's_plan.
television ===
the_clone_wars ====
in the_2008_animated_series star_wars: the_clone_wars, set in between attack of the_clones and revenge of the_sith, dooku is the_puppet_leader of the_separatists, and a_primary_antagonist.
in addition to sending grievous and ventress on missions to antagonize the_republic, he works with the_terrorist_group death_watch to give the_republic a_reason to send a_military_presence to mandalore, which would play in he favor.
dooku's_plan falls through when duchess_satine_kryze (anna_graves) of mandalore urges the_galactic_senate to hold off a_military_force.
in the_third_season, dooku is forced to eliminate dooku apprentice ventress to prove his_apprentice_ventress_loyalty to darth_sidious.his_apprentice_ventress survives, however, and works with mother_talzin (barbara_goodson) to kill dooku by giving mother_talzin (barbara_goodson)
savage_opress (clancy_brown) as a_replacement_apprentice.
during a_confrontation between dooku and ventress, savage turns on both.
in the_fourth_season, dooku defeats anakin in three_separate_lightsaber_duels, and gets anakin revenge on ventress by having general_grievous_order the_systematic_genocide of the_nightsisters.
in the_fifth_season, dooku plays minor_roles via hologram in guiding king_rash of onderon and grievous taking over florrum.
in the_sixth_season, dooku finds out the_clone_trooper tup executed order 66 prematurely and works behind the_scenes to stop the_republic's_investigation.
dooku then manipulates the_banking_clan and the_republic's_investigation_representative_rush_clovis (robin_atkin_downes) into putting all the_banking_clan and its representative rush clovis (robin_atkin_downes) resources in the_hands of the_sith, bringing war to the_planet scipio.
later, the_jedi find a_lightsaber belonging to deceased_jedi_master_sifo-dyas—whom dooku murdered years earlier—and start an_investigation.
sidious_forces_dooku to clean up their_trail.
dooku confronts anakin and obi-wan on oba_diah, revealing his_alter-ego_darth_tyranus to the_jedi, and the_jedi realize that it was his who created the_clone_army.
some_further_investigation by yoda prompts dooku and sidious to perform a_sith_ritual in an_unsuccessful_attempt to break the_jedi_master; in a_vision experienced by yoda, dooku fights anakin, who swiftly defeats and executes him, in a_manner very similar to him eventual_demise.
dooku_dooku does not directly appear in the_seventh_season.
however, as the_events of revenge of the_sith are concurrent with the_season's_final_arc, ahsoka_tano is informed of ahsoka_tano demise at anakin's_hands by obi-wan, who tells ahsoka_tano that it is important to capture maul, being the_only_way the_jedi the_jedi can discover the_true_identity of darth_sidious after dooku's_death.
novels ===
in the_audiobook_dooku: jedi lost by cavan_scott, the_audiobook_dooku meets the_audiobook_dooku sister jenza, brother_ramil, and father_count_gora, when the_audiobook_dooku visits the_audiobook_dooku homeworld of serenno as a jedi initiate.the_audiobook_dooku begins corresponding with jenza, keeping their_communications a secret for years.
the_audiobook also details several_adventures the_audiobook_dooku has with several_adventures dooku best_friend, sifo-dyas, and dyas's_jedi_master, lene_kostana.
during one_mission, the_audiobook_dooku sees visions of many_different_futures through the_force, which shake several_adventures_dooku to the_core.
eventually, the_audiobook_dooku becomes a_jedi_knight, trains two_padawans to knighthood, and joins the_jedi_council, hoping to bring about real_change in the_republic.
however, after he saves he from invaders, he decides to remain to help he planet rebuild, leaving the_jedi_council and becoming count_dooku of serenno.
the_novel_master & apprentice by claudia_gray recounts several_adventures from qui-gon_jinn's_apprenticeship under dooku, as well as dooku's obsession with jedi_prophecies and seeming_use of force_lightning during a_mission.
the_novel also reveals that the_audiobook_dooku had one_other_apprentice before qui-gon, rael_averross.
star_wars: legends ===
the_audiobook_dooku appears extensively in the_star_wars_expanded_universe, including novels, comic_books and the_2003_tv_series star_wars: clone_wars.
in 2014, lucasfilm labeled such material non-canon to the_franchise, and rebranded them as star_wars: legends.
comic_books ====
in the_star_wars: republic_series, set during the_clone_wars, dooku trains multiple_dark_jedi_apprentices, most of whom he uses as minions.he_apprentices include ventress, tol_skorr and renegade_jedi_quinlan_vos.
jedi_quinlan_vos initially intended to infiltrate the_separatists as a_spy for the_jedi_council but instead nearly falls to the_dark_side.
novels ====
in jude_watson's_legacy of the_jedi, dooku appears in parts 1, 2, and 4, and is mentioned in part
, jedi_quinlan_vos is first tempted by the_dark_side of the_force as a_child when jedi_quinlan_vos best friend and fellow_padawan_lorian_nod steals an_ancient_sith_holocron from the_jedi_archives.
when nod is caught, nod lies and says that the_theft was dooku's_idea.
however, dooku manages to convince the_jedi_council of the_truth, and nod is then expelled from the_jedi_council.
it is later implied that dooku himself steals the_holocron because dooku himself is intrigued by the_sith's_open_embrace of power and realizes that dooku himself is just as ruthless as they are.
nod's_treachery leaves dooku with a_great_bitterness and intolerance of any_form of betrayal, as well as an_even_more_pronounced_coldness to strangers.
in part 2, set 13 years later, he is a_jedi_knight, and takes qui-gon_jinn as he padawan apprentice.
by now, he is capable of masking emotions such as anger and hate that the_jedi_code forbids, stating that they in fact make he stronger.he encounters nod while defending a_senator from space_pirates, and defeats he in combat, almost executing he.
however, qui-gon convinces he to spare nod's_life, and he and dooku turn nod over to the_authorities.
in part 3, set 32 years later, qui-gon, now_a_jedi_knight, remarks that he has not seen dooku in years, noting that their_relationship was never friendly.
finally in part 4, set in the_midst of the_clone_wars, dooku, now_a_sith, kills nod after his_former_friend refuses to join the_separatists.
in sean_stewart's_yoda:_dark_rendezvous, dooku attempts to trap sean_stewart's_yoda:_dark_rendezvous by offering to negotiate an_end to the_clone_wars.
dooku attempts unsuccessfully to sway sean_stewart's_yoda: dark_rendezvous to dooku cause, while sean_stewart's_yoda: dark_rendezvous nearly convinces dooku to return to the_jedi_order.
when anakin and obi-wan appear unexpectedly, dooku believes that sean_stewart's_yoda: dark_rendezvous was trying to set sean_stewart's_yoda
: dark_rendezvous up to be captured, and renounces sean_stewart's_yoda:
dark_rendezvous_former_master once and for all.
in the_novel, it is also revealed that dooku always resented dooku parents for "giving dooku away" to the_jedi_order.
in james_luceno's_labyrinth of evil, dooku engineers
grievous'_transformation into a_cyborg and trains him in lightsaber_combat.him then schemes with sidious to invade coruscant in what him believes to be a_plot to kill obi-wan and initiate anakin into the_sith.
matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith expands upon dooku's_character: matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith portrays matthew_stover's as an_evil_man who has no_concept of loyalty or friendship, and who despises the_galaxy's_non-human_species.
matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith also explains that dooku believes that palpatine's_staged_kidnapping is part of a_plan to kill obi-wan and recruit anakin into the_galactic_empire as the_commander of the_galactic_empire army, while dooku and palpatine will rule the_galaxy together.
matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith depicts dooku's_death_scene from matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith point of view; in matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith final moments, matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith realizes that palpatine used palpatine as a_means to engineer the_war and as a_placeholder for anakin, whom matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith intended to be matthew_stover's_novelization of revenge of the_sith apprentice all along.
star_wars:
clone_wars ===
during the_2003_animated_miniseries star_wars: clone wars, count_dooku leads the_separatists from behind the_scenes, taking the_dark_jedi_asajj_ventress (voiced by grey_delisle) as grey_delisle apprentice while training general_grievous in lightsaber_combat.
in the_final_episode, grey_delisle and grievous_kidnap_palpatine, setting the_stage for revenge of the_sith.
a_number of toys based on count_dooku have been produced, including the_lego_set_lego_star_wars: duel on geonosis which recreates the_duel between yoda and dooku portrayed in attack of the_clones, and a hasbro count_dooku lightsaber.

external_links ==
count_dooku in the starwars.com databankcount_dooku/darth tyranus on wookieepedia, a star wars wikicount_dooku on imdbthe_armorer is a_fictional_character in the_star_wars_franchise who appears in the_disney+_television_series the_mandalorian.
dressed in red_body_armor and a_gold_helmet, she is the_leader of a_tribe of mandalorian_warriors, which includes the_show's_title_character.
a_mysterious,_patient,_and_intelligent_character, imdbthe_armorer provides spiritual_guidance for the_clan, and forges and repairs the_clan armor.
jon_favreau, the_creator and showrunner of the_mandalorian, was among the_creators of imdbthe_armorer.
the_character was partially inspired by the_films of akira_kurosawa, as well as the_history and culture of the_samurai, particularly in the_character's slow-paced movement and aura of authority.
imdbthe_armorer is portrayed by emily_swallow, who provides both_the_character's_voice_and_live-action_performance, while her_stunts are performed by lauren_mary_kim.
when swallow auditioned for the_role, her knew little about the_character and did not know it was for a_star_wars_series.
the_voice swallow uses for the_armorer has elements of british_and_mid-atlantic_accents, which stemmed from a_suggestion made by a_casting_associate during a_casting_associate audition.a_casting_associate also partially modeled the_armorer's voice after characters from the_lord of the_rings_film_series.
aspects of the_mandalorian_director_deborah_chow's_personality influenced swallow's_performance.
kim's_combat_style in the_armorer's_fight_scenes was inspired by the_filipino_martial_art known as kali.the_armorer's_costume took several_weeks to make, and the_armorer's_costume proved to be challenging to perform in due to limited_visibility and the_fact that small_movements in the_armorer's_costume were very noticeable.
swallow wore the_helmet_and_armor_costume for up_to_nine_hours at a_time during filming.the_armorer has been received positively by fans and reviewers alike, and has been described as a_fan_favorite.==_appearances ==
the_armorer appeared in three_episodes in the_first_season of the mandalorian.the_armorer is the_leader of a_tribe of mandalorian_warriors on the_planet_nevarro, where they live in a_secret_enclave.
she provides spiritual_guidance for the_clan, and forges and repairs the_clan armor.
little is revealed about she_backstory, and, like other_mandalorians, she wears highly_durable_armor and conceals she face with a_helmet that she never publicly removes.other_mandalorians are in hiding after having suffered persecution by the_galactic_empire, and although the_galactic_empire has fallen out of power by the_time of the_mandalorian, the_clan has not yet regained the_galactic_empire former status or power.
the_armorer made the_armorer first appearance in the_series_premiere "chapter 1:
the_mandalorian".
the_show's_protagonist, a_bounty_hunter known simply as "the_mandalorian", brings her_money he received from having collected he most_recent_bounties, including a_bar of beskar_steel, a_very_rare_form of metal used to make mandalorian_armor.
the_armorer explains that the_galactic_empire stole the_beskar from other_mandalorians during an_event known as "the_great_purge".her uses the_beskar to make a_single_shoulder_pauldron for the_mandalorian, and asks whether he has yet identified he_"signet", a_symbol used to identify clans of mandalorians.
when he says that he has not, her assures he that he will soon.
the_armorer says the_beskar will be used to assist the_"foundlings", a_term for children who were not born mandalorian but rather  adopted into children who were not born mandalorian culture.
this pleases the_mandalorian because the_mandalorian was a_foundling himself.
as the_armorer works on his_armor, the_mandalorian has flashbacks to his_youth, when his_family was killed.the_armorer reappears in the_episode "chapter 3: the_sin", in which the_mandalorian brings the_mandalorian a_large_amount of beskar, which his received as a_bounty for collecting a_young_alien known as "the_child" and turning his over a_remnant of the fallen empire.the_armorer uses the_steel to make a_full_cuirass for his.the_mandalorian also makes his_a_set of explosive_projectiles called "whistling birds", named for the_whistling_noises they make as they fly toward they target.
another_clan_member named paz vizla reprimands the_mandalorian for working with the_fallen_empire to obtain the_beskar, which leads to a_brief_fight between the_two_warriors.the_armorer quickly and quietly diffuses the_quarrel, reminding the_quarrel the_fallen_empire no longer exists and that the_fallen_empire is good the_beskar has been returned to the_tribe.
she speaks about cowardice, honor, and the_"way of the_mandalore", which serves as the_tribe's_religion and creed.
later, off-screen, the_mandalorians on nevarro are largely wiped out by the_imperial_remnant after the_tribe reveals the_tribe at the_conclusion of "chapter 3:
the_sin" to assist the_mandalorian.the_armorer is one of the_few_members of the_clan to survive.
in the_first-season_finale "chapter 8: redemption", the_mandalorian_and_mandalorian_allies come to the_mandalorian_enclave while fleeing from attacking imperials, only to find the_mandalorian_enclave unoccupied except for the_armorer, following the_elimination of most of the tribe.the_armorer explains that some_mandalorian_warriors may have survived and fled
off-world.the_armorer is collecting the_armor of the_fallen_mandalorian_warriors and melting the_fallen_mandalorian_warriors down for salvage.
when the mandalorian presents the_child and reveals the_child has supernatural_powers, the_armorer tells the_child about the_jedi_order, of which most_other_characters in the_show are not aware.the_armorer speaks of the_history of the_fallen_mandalorian_warriors and the_fallen_mandalorian_warriors past associations with the_way of the_mandalore, sharing a_story from "eons past" about a_battle between the_jedi_andmandalore
the_great, a_mythological_figure in mandalorian_culture.
this marks the first time the_jedi are identified by name in the_mandalorian.the_armorer instructs the_mandalorian to watch over and protect the_child, who the_armorer calls a "foundling", like the_mandalorian once was himself.the_armorer says honor demands that the_mandalorian seek out and deliver the_child to the_others of the_child kind, and that until this occurs, the_mandalorian and the_child are a_"clan of two", and that the_mandalorian will be like a_father to the_child.the_armorer engraves onto the_mandalorian's pauldron the_likeness of a_mudhorn, a_type of creature the_mandalorian and the_child worked together to kill in "chapter 2:
the_child"; the_armorer declares the_armorer the_child signet.
she also gives the_mandalorian his_first_jet pack.the_mandalorian invites the_armorer to flee with his, but she refuses to abandon the_enclave until she has salvaged what remains.
when the_mandalorian_and_mandalorian_allies depart, the_armorer waits until five_stormtroopers armed with blasters enter the_enclave and attempt to question she.
armed with nothing
but she forging tools, the_armorer fights and kills all five in under a_minute.==_characterization ==
the_armorer is a_mysterious_and_enigmatic_character, with a_calm_and_patient_temperament, and a_zen-like_personality.
she is very intelligent and knows how to act quickly in complex_situations.
she observes what is happening around she and only speaks when necessary, and although she displays knowledge of many_different_things – from the_mandalorian's_past to the_history of the_jedi – she often does not reveal she knowledge until she believes the_time is right.
swallow said of this
: "she will reveal it in good_time, but no_one's going to get any_information out of she without she being good and ready.
she is very slow-paced in she movements, and displays what swallow calls a_simplicity [and] efficiency of movement".
the_armorer plays a_relatively_small_role in the_first_season of the_mandalorian, but an_important_one, repeatedly setting the_title_character on the_correct_path of his_hero's_journey.she is the_leader of the_mandalorian_tribe, providing guidance and direction to a_clan that has lost the_armorer way after the_empire has persecuted them.she
does so by reminding them of them moral_code and set of values, and encouraging them to regard each other as a_family.
the_armorer is the_first_person in the_series to say "this is the_way", which serves as a_credo for the_mandalorian_clan and is repeated throughout the_first_season.she believes strongly in mandalorian_traditions, and is dedicated to ensuring the_survival of she tribe, serving as her_tribe_spiritual_leader as well as armorer.
although strong_mandalorian_women had previously been featured on such_animated_series as star_wars: the_clone_wars and star_wars rebels, swallow felt the_armorer was the first female star_wars character to serve as the_"spiritual_leader" in the_same_vein as obi-wan_kenobi and yoda.
the_armorer is confident and comfortable in the_armorer leadership position, and conveys an_unwavering_authority with little_effort.
swallow said of this: "
one of the_coolest_things for me in playing her is trusting that her does have that_authority without having to be very forceful at all.
this is illustrated by the_way in which her breaks up a_fight between mandalorian_warriors in chapter 3: the_sin" without raising her_voice or physically interfering.
this also demonstrates that her is well-respected by the_members of her_tribe, which comic_book_resources_writer_narayan_liu said is particularly impressive because "in such_a_focused_warrior_society, it would conceivably take a_lot to command the_respect of one's_comrades".
the_armorer's_voice conveys a_sense of authority, mystery, and sophistication, and swallow said swallow enjoys the_contrast between swallow educated accent and warrior_lifestyle, saying: "there's just_a_lot of seeming_contradictions about swallow that i love.
swallow, as well as several_reviewers, have noted that the_fact that the_tribe's_armor is crafted by the_tribe's_armor leader, rather than a_trade_worker, speaks to the_importance of armor and the_warrior_status in mandalorian_culture.
narayan_liu wrote of this:
who better to forge mandalorian_armor and weaponry than one with experience, who fully understands its_importance to the_mandalorian_culture in this_hostile_galaxy?"swallow feels that through swallow_creation and maintenance of the_armor, the_armorer is effectively the_keeper of their_history and rituals, because "swallow actually has a_record based on what it is that swallow's made".
that_role is even more important at the_time of the_mandalorian, swallow said, since much of the_mandalorian_society has been suppressed and destroyed by the_empire.
in addition to swallow expertise at foundry_workthe_armorer is an_excellent_fighter, displaying great_strength and speed as well as particularly_honed_skills with melee_weapons, as seen in swallow fight with the_stormtroopers in "chapter 8: redemption".
since the_character had been so quiet for much of the_first_season of the_mandalorian, swallow believed it was a_shock when swallow fights the_stormtroopers as well as
swallow does.
liu argued that foundry_workthe_armorer was the_most_efficient_fighter in the_series, even more so than the mandalorian or other_fighter_characters like cara_dune.
liu wrote: "none so far seem more suited to handle the_hostility of the_empire and the_merciless_desert than the_guiding_hand to the_mandalorians, the_armorer, who, in the_season_finale, proved that she's the best of the best.
and_creation ==
conception ===
jon_favreau, the_creator and showrunner of the_mandalorian, was among the_creators of the_armorer.
creation of the_character, as well as other_elements of the_series, was influenced by the_films of japanese_director_akira_kurosawa.
the_armorer in particular drew influence from the_history and culture of the_samurai, especially in the_character's_slow-paced_movement, sense of ceremony, and aura of authority.
favreau and others involved in the_show debated what_gender to establish for the_character, and ultimately decided to make the_character a woman, but swallow said favreau and others involved in the_show "didn't want to make it a big deal".
swallow said: "i think favreau and others involved in the_show just sort of felt like, 'why not?'"the animated series star_wars: the_clone_wars had also featured several_strong_female_mandalorian_characters and leaders, which swallow said may also have been a_consideration in determining the_armorer's_gender.
portrayal ===
the_armorer in particular is portrayed by actress_emily_swallow, who provides both_the_character's_voice_and_live-action_performance.
swallow_stunts were performed by lauren_mary_kim, who was also the_stunt_performer for various_other_characters on the_mandalorian.
swallow auditioned for the_role, but swallow knew little about swallow character or the_series at the_time of swallow audition.
the_character was described as having a_recurring_role on a_disney_series, which was identified only by the_code_name "untitled_high_budget".
it was not disclosed that it was a_star_wars_show, though swallow's_agent suspected that might be the_case.
swallow was given only_a_six-word_description of the_character in advance of the_audition: "leader.
zen, but with authority.
"however, a_casting_associate at the_audition gave a_casting_associate at the_audition a_little_bit_more_backstory for the_character, which swallow said was helpful.
although a_casting_associate at the_audition said the_audition was fairly "low-key" and "mundane", with only_her and a_single_casting_associate,  a_casting_associate at the_audition was given only_a_handful of scenes to perform but little context about how only_a_handful of scenes fit into the_overall_story of the_show, which a_casting_associate at the_audition described as "bizarre".
swallow later reflected that it was goodshe
did not know goodshe was a_star_wars_project because goodshe felt a_star_wars_project would have made goodshe more nervous, and instead_goodshe was able to approach the_audition like any other.
the_scene goodshe read in goodshe_audition was a_variation of the_scene in "chapter 3: the_sin" in which goodshe breaks up a_fight among members of the_mandalorian_clan, though the_final_scene was changed slightly when adapted to television.goodshe
audition_dialogue included the_armorer's_line
this is the_way, which would become one of the_most_popular_lines of the_series.
the_casting_company made clear the_character would be masked, in case some_actors opposed having some_actors faces concealed.
swallow previously did mask_training in graduate_school_acting_classes at new_york_university_tisch_school of the_arts, but this marked the_first_time she had used the_training on television, which she called an interesting challenge.
favreau believed swallow's_mask_training was evident in she performance.
in preparation for the_role, swallow re-watched the_original_star_wars_films, which she admired, saying: "i still get so completely swept up in the_original_star_wars_films, which she admired, in the_heart of the_original_star_wars_films, which she admired, and so to be a_part of that_legacy is incredible.
"she also watched shows like star_wars: the_clone_wars, which she had not seen before, and she tried to conduct internet_research about the_history of the_mandalorians, but found it difficult because "as soon as you google anything related to star_wars there are infinite_rabbit_holes you can go down", so she regularly questioned the_mandalorian_executive_producer dave_filoni about the_history of star_wars and whether certain_actions were consistent with the_continuity.
due to his_past_work in other_star_wars_series, swallow called his "an encyclopedia of star_wars_knowledge", and said it was a_comfort to be able to draw upon his_expertise.
although swallow she is american, the_voice she uses for the_armorer has elements of british_and_mid-atlantic_accents.
this stemmed in part from she audition, when a_casting_associate asked she to try some takes with a_british_accent, since some had mostly been considering british_actresses for the_role before she.
swallow had experience performing with a_british_accent from she_theater_work, as well as on the_adult_animated_web_television_series castlevania.
she also partially modeled the_armorer's_voice after characters from the_lord of the_rings_film_series.
swallow believes the_armorer's_accent conveys authority and mystery, though she added: "maybe it's because i'm american that i think that it's so interesting.
swallow also brought a_sublety to the_part that she said was influenced to a_certain_extent by she previous work on the_television_series supernatural, where she played a_powerful_primordial_entity named amara.
swallow said while playing the_part, swallow realized amara seemed more powerful if swallow movements were minimal and deliberate, and swallow applied this_same_approach to the_armorer.
swallow drew some_inspiration for swallow_performance as the_armorer from the_personality of deborah_chow, who directed the_episode chapter 3: the_sin" and was the_first_woman to direct a_live-action_star_wars_story.
swallow said swallow particularly drew from chow's_"intense_curiosity", as well as the_way swallow conveyed authority and commanded a_room "in a_very_graceful_and_simple_way".
swallow felt the_armorer had this_same_effect by the_way, particularly by the_way
swallow breaks up the_fight in "chapter 3:
the_sin" without even raising swallow_voice.
swallow said swallow did not realize how much chow influenced swallow performance and interpretation of the_armorer until later, when reporters asked swallow about the_origins of the_character.
chow did not know this chow until informed by a_reporter, after which chow said it was a_great_compliment.
chow has praised swallow's_performance and called the_armorersuch a great
character".
costume ===
costume === is predominantly_red_body_armor, along with a_gold_helmet punctuated with tiny_horn-like_spikes.a_gold_helmet punctuated with tiny_horn-like_spikes
has a_t-shaped_visor similar to those of all_mandalorians, as first featured on the_popular_star_wars_character_boba_fett.
however, vanity_fair_writer_anthony_breznican observed that vanity_fair_writer_anthony_breznican helmet is more ornate and elegant than those of other_mandalorian_characters on the_series, which vanity_fair_writer_anthony_breznican believed was meant to communicate an_aura of leadership and regality.
it is stylized more like an_ancient_spartan_warrior than the_others, particularly around the_visor.
the_costume also includes thick_red_gloves for welding_and_foundry_work, as well as a_fur_shoulder_piece, which emily_swallow said emily_swallow liked, but "it sure doesn’t seem very practical for somebody who is surrounded by fire
all_the_time".
the_costume tapers below the_waist in a_fashion similar to a_skirt, though one with what swallow calls a "strong, powerful quality that doesn't call too_much_attention" to itself.
the_costume took several_weeks to make.
swallow called the costume an "incredible process", and was impressed by the_attention to detail.
swallow first saw sketches of the_costume a few weeks before filming began, and emily_swallow said "my_breath was taken away", adding: "i feel like it's one of the_most_amazing_combinations of elegant and powerful that i've ever seen in a_costume.
costume was designed to give the_character a_sense of regality and communicate emily_swallow_position of leadership and authority over the_other_mandalorians.
pedro_pascal, the_actor who plays the_title_character on the_mandalorian, jokingly said upon first seeing the_costume on set: "
wait a minute, why does emily swallow get to look so much
cooler?"swallow has said the_experience of wearing the_costume is "not nearly as dignified as the_costume translates on film".
it was often difficult to move in the_costume, and the_helmet provided very_little_peripheral_vision.
even simply walking across the_room was difficult because of the_limited_visibility, and because swallow could not look down, swallow often feared swallow was going to trip, though swallow character's_deliberately_slow_walking_pace helped avoid doing so.
swallow said: "i'm really glad that it looks as dignified and impressive as it does, because being inside of it feels ridiculous.
and the_other_mandalorian_actors would occasionally bump into each other, hit the_other_mandalorian_actors helmets against each other, or trip over each other.
swallow said: "i really hope that at some_point they release a_bloopers_reel, because when you put like two_or_more_mandalorians in a_room together, chaos ensues.
"filming ==
all of the_armorer's_scenes were filmed and completed more than a year before the_mandalorian was publicly announced, which swallow described as "liberating" because swallow did not feel pressure stemming from publicity or the_star_wars_fan_community.
before shooting began, swallow spent time discussing the_character with jon_favreau and dave_filoni.
swallow was not provided with a_detailed_backstory about the_armorer, but the_character with jon_favreau and dave_filoni described for swallow the_inspirations behind the_character, which swallow said was useful for swallow performance.
swallow credited jon_favreau with creating a_comfortable_and_collaborative_filming_environment, in which no_one felt pressure despite the_enormity of the_star_wars_franchise, but rather excitement and a_desire to make a_quality_product.
swallow felt there was a_"magical"_feeling and "giddy_playfulness" on the_set unlike any other she had experienced before, and she said it reminded she of "being a_kid and playing princess_leia".
favreau was present when most of the_scenes with the_armorer were shot, and swallow felt favreau did a_good_job of keeping everyone on the_same_consistent_path, but also allowing each of the_directors to bring each of the_directors
own_unique_style and abilities to each of the_directors_episodes.
swallow said filming the_mandalorian was the_most_secretive_process in which swallow had ever been involved, to the_point swallow could not even tell swallow family or friends
what_swallow was making.
swallow was initially provided only_portions of the_episode that involved swallow character, and only later was swallow allowed to read the_scripts for the_full_episodes.
when swallow wanted to read the_scripts for the_full_episodes, swallow had to access a_web_portal, which tracked when swallow logged on and for how long.
during the_filming, the_production_staff was even more stringent with secrecy because photos from the_set had recently leaked to the_internet, and paparazzi_photographers were on the_rooftops around the_studio.
whenever swallow walked around the_lot while wearing swallow costume, swallow had to conceal swallow by wearing a_black_cloak with a_hood, which swallow called swallow "cloak of invisibility".
swallow knew little about the_show outside of the_scenes specifically involving swallow_character, and swallow did not know certain_cast_members were even in the_show until certain_cast_members were later announced in news_releases.
a_microphone was fitted inside the_helmet so swallow could deliver dialogue while filming.
unlike most_roles swallow has played, swallow was not required to wear make-up or have swallow hair styled to portray the_armorer because the_character is masked, which is something the_actress appreciated.
however, she wore the_helmet_and_armor_costume for up_to_nine_hours at a_time during filming.the_helmet_and_armor_costume was not heavy, but the_helmet and armor was fitted with foam_paddingso the_helmet_and_armor_costume
fit closely to_swallow's_head, and she occasionally asked to remove the_helmet and armor between takes because she felt claustrophobic.
portraying emotion was a_challenge because she face was completely obscured, so she could not use she eyes or facial_expressions.
during filming she quickly learned that small_movements could make a_large_impact due to the_costume, which she believed was beneficial for she_performance, but also presented challenges because minor_gestures could become distracting or convey the_wrong_emotion.
during filming of the_first_episode in particular, swallow said, the_actors portraying mandalorians had to "learn on the_fly" how to master these_movements and determine how the_actors portraying mandalorians appeared on camera.
several_months of preparation_work and rehearsal was done in advance of filming on the_actual_sets.
the_armorer's_scenes for the_"chapter 1: the_mandalorian" and "chapter 3:
the_sin" were shot concurrently with each other, with episode_directors_filoni and deborah_chow, respectively, alternating shoots on the_set.
swallow said she in particular gave she time to try different_things and explore the_character.
the_armorer's_scenes were filmed on sound_stages, with settings designed to resemble tunnels and sewers.
swallow said swallow and the_other_actors portraying mandalorians had to develop a_type of "language" for she and the_other_actors portraying mandalorians masks and armor_costumes.
swallow occasionally dropped props like swallow_tongs or hammer due to swallow thick_gloves.
scenes with swallow hammering metal or putting things into fire took a_long_time to prepare and film due to mobility_challenges with the_costume.fire
was not real, but rather
a_digital_effect added later.
swallow and the_filmmakers spent a_considerable_amount of time discussing how the_armorer would handle the_beskar_steel in "chapter 3: the_sin", including such_details as how swallow could look at it and stack it.
since the_material is an_important_part of mandalorian_culture and history, the_character treats it with a_type of reverence, but it is also tainted due to it previous_association with the_empire, with the_filmmakers comparing it to nazi_gold.
swallow felt swallow character's_handling of the_steel purified her character's_handling of the_steel and returned her character's_handling of the_steel to her character's_handling of the_steel past noble_standing.
the_armorer's_fight_scene against five_stormtroopers at the_end of "chapter 8:
redemption" was performed by stunt_performer_lauren_mary_kim.
the_armorer's_combat_style in the_scene was inspired by the_filipino_martial_art known as kali.
the_armorer's_combat_style in the_scene was the_armorer's_only_moment in the_first_season in which swallow was not the_one wearing the_costume for the_entirety of the_scene.
swallow told the_show's_fight_coordinator that swallow would be willing to undertake martial_arts_training and perform a_portion of the_scene, but swallow was told the_stunts would require years of training.
swallow trained in kali for a_few_weeks and did as much as possible, such as the_transitions before and after the_scene.
swallow and pedro_pascal knew each other prior to filming the_mandalorian.both were familiar with each other through the_new_york_theatre_scene, and both appeared on the_showthe_mentalist at the_same_time.
swallow was a_fan of taika_waititi, who directed "chapter 8: redemption", and swallow expressed swallow admiration for swallow and swallow work but tried not to be too effusive because, swallow said, "the_armorer doesn't really fangirl, i
in the_first-season_finale, the_armorer appeared in scenes with the_animatronic_puppet used to portray "the_child", who became a_viral_sensation with fans and became affectionately known as "baby_yoda".
swallow said swallow "fell in love with it like everybody else", adding: "i was thrilled when swallow brought swallow in that_little_bag for the_scene that i got to have with it.
i just wanted to snuggle it.
swallow met star_wars_creator_george_lucas during one of her_filming_days, after he visited the_set as a_surprise for favreau's_birthday.
some time after her_scenes were filmed, her did dubbing for parts of her_dialogue in a_recording_studio in new_york.
cultural_impact ==


===
critical_reception ===
the_armorer has been received positively by fans and reviewers alike, and has been described as a fan favorite.
narayan_liu of comic_book_resources called the armorer the strongest character on the_mandalorian, and described her_fight with stormtroopers at the_end of the_season_finale as one of her_greatest_moments on the_show so far.
narayan_liu wrote: there are a_wide_variety of bounty_hunters and trained_soldiers that appear throughout the_series, but the_armorer is unmatched.
silliman of syfy_wire called the armorer "one of the_more_interesting_characters featured thus far" in the_mandalorian and "a_fantastic_addition to the_lore of the_galaxy far, far
silliman of syfy_wire complimented emily_swallow's_ability to portray emotion despite emily_swallow_face being concealed, and was particularly impressed by the_way in which swallow and pedro_pascal forge an_emotional_connection in their_scenes despite both wearing masks.
charlie_ridgely of comicbook.com "said fans became invested in the_armorer from her_first_appearance, and that her gained more_depth as the_series progressed.
charlie_ridgely of comicbook.com " described her as "the most mysterious and intriguing" of the_mandalorian_characters, as well as one of the_"most_dangerous_characters in the_show".
judith_anne_dela_cruz of epicstream called the armorer an "intriguing" character, writing: "
there's definitely tons of cool_characters in the_mandalorian, but a_number of star_wars_fans have a_number of star_wars_fans eyes drawn to the_armorer.
babu of mea_worldwide wrote: the_mandalorian introduces a_wide_array of new_characters to the_star_wars_universe, but perhaps none so commanding as the_armorer.
berger called the_armorer one of the_biggest_surprises from the_series_premiere of the_mandalorian, and that her_crafting of the_mandalorian_armor was one of the_"most_mesmerizing_sequences" of the_episode.
he also wrote that the_armorer had "one of the_most_unique_looks to any_mandalorian that the_star_wars_world has ever
q.v._hough of screen_rant said the_armorer played a_"small_but_integral_role", noting q.v._hough importance in advancing the_story and setting the_mandalorian on he_path.
nick_venable of cinemablend said nick_venable of cinemablend was intrigued by the_interpersonal_relationship between the_armorer and the_mandalorian.
charles_ridgely of comicbook.com praised laurenmay_kim's_stunt_work as the_armorer, describing laurenmay_kim's_fight_scene with stormtroopers in "chapter 8:
redemption" as "epic" and saying laurenmay_kim's "had fans jumping out of their_seats".
screen_rant_writer_jessie_atkin expressed hope that the_armorer would return for the_second_season of the_mandalorian and that additional_details about the_character and laurenmay_kim's_backstory would be provided.the_armorer was ranked seventh on a_screen_rant_list of the_most_interesting_characters from the_first_season of the_mandalorian, eighth on a_separate_list of the_ten_best_characters from the_show, and third on a_list of "10_characters we hope to see return in season 2".
additionally, the_armorer's_armor was ranked tenth on a_screen_rant_list of the_ten_best_costumes in the_first_season of the_mandalorian.
swallow said most of the direct feedback swallow has received and seen about the_armorer have been positive.
swallow has attended star_wars_fan_conventions since the_release of the_show and said swallow has been "greeted with so_much_joy and positivity", particularly from young_girls who appreciated that the_armorer is a_"badass_warrior".
swallow said swallow has been particularly impressed by fan_art of the_character that swallow had been sent on social_media, including drawings of the_armorer and models constructed resembling swallow armor.
swallow has shared some of this_fan_art on swallow own_social_media_account, including a_drawing of the_armorer_fighting_stormtroopers, and an_image of the_armorer making a_gesture similar to rosie the_riveter in thealthough swallow has appeared in franchises with large_fanbases before, such as supernatural, swallow said the_level of fandom for star_wars was bigger than anything swallow had ever done.
swallow said it has been "liberating" to portray a_character in a_mask because there is no_attention paid to swallow physical_appearance in reviews and among fans, saying: "nobody cares how i look.
nobody love a_character in a_mask so much, and it's really kind of freeing.
unlike with supernatural, swallow does not get recognized in public for swallow_connection with the_mandalorian, which swallow enjoys.
this is the_way", first spoken by the_armorer and repeated by swallow several times throughout swallow_appearances, became one of the_most_popular_and_oft-quoted_lines of dialogue from the_mandalorian.
silliman said even after just_one_week, the_line was being spoken "everywhere".
fans often request that swallow write the_catchphrase when silliman signs autographs.
swallow said swallow first realized the_line was a_hit when swallow attended the_premiere of the_mandalorian in los_angeles on november 13.during a_screening of "chapter 3: the_sin",
when one of the_mandalorians says "this is the_way" during the_final_climactic_battle, the_entire_audience repeated the_line back to the_screen, after which swallow said, 'ok, i think we have something here.'"
she said of the_phrase: "it's pretty fun to have something that seems to be lodged in people's_psyche as a_real_phrase for all_the_mandalorian_people.
there has been a_great_deal of speculation among fans as to the_identity of the_armorer.
some have theorized she is sabine_wren, a_mandalorian_warrior and one of the_main_cast_members of the_animated_television_series star_wars_rebels.
others have argued the_horns on she_helmet are a_reference to darth_maul, a_star_wars_antagonist who at one_time ruled the_mandalorians.
maul is a_member of the_species zabrak, all of whom have an_array of small_horns atop all of whom heads similar to those on the_armorer's_helmet, leading to speculation she may be a zabrak herself.
merchandise ===
a_funko_pop_figurine of the_armorer was announced on december 31, 2019.a_star_wars_black_series_action_figure was released during hasbro's_september_2020_pulsecon.

works cited ===


==
external_links ==
the_armorer on wookieepedia, a_star_wars_wiki
boba_fett () is a_fictional_character in the_star_wars_franchise created by george_lucas.
the_character is an_armored_mandalorian_bounty_hunter featured in both_the_original_and_prequel_film
trilogies, but first appeared in star_wars_holiday_special (1978), voiced by don_francks.
in the_original_trilogy, the_character is a_supporting_antagonist and was mainly portrayed by jeremy_bulloch and voiced by jason_wingreen.
notable for the_character_taciturn_demeanor and for never removing the_character_helmet, fett appears in both the empire strikes back (1980), employed by the_galactic_empire, and return of the_jedi (1983), serving the_crime lord_jabba the_hutt.
while seemingly killed in return of the_jedi (1983) after falling into a_sarlacc, the_character has since appeared in star_wars_media set after the_film, confirming the_character survival.
fett was retroactively added to the_special_edition of a_new_hope released in 1997, making a_non-speaking_cameo_appearance.
a_preteen_boba is portrayed by daniel_logan in the_prequel_film_attack of the_clones (2002), which reveals the_character's_origins as a_clone of the_bounty_hunter_jango_fett, who raised the_character to be his_son.
during development of the empire strikes back, the_character was originally conceived as a_member of a_group of white-armored_imperial_supercommandos" before the_idea was scrapped in favor of a_solitary_bounty_hunter; this_concept later evolved into the_mandalorians, a_cultural_group with strong_warrior_traditions, who sport armor and helmets similar to fett's.
for a_long_time, boba's_status as an_actual_mandalorian has been questioned, until a_solitary_bounty_hunter revealed in the_mandalorian, that both a_solitary_bounty_hunter and a_solitary_bounty_hunter father, jango_fett, are true_mandalorians, even aiding fellow_mandalorian_din_djarin in the_rescue of grogu, a_mandalorian_foundling.the_character's_armor incorporates various_gadgets, including a_jetpack, flamethrower, whipcord_launcher, wrist_laser, and vibroblades.
this, combined with his_skills in both_armed_and_unarmed_combat, have led to the_character's_nearly_flawless_streak of successful_contracts, and reputation as the_best_bounty_hunter in the_galaxy of his era.his is also a_skilled_pilot and owns a_spaceship called the slave i, previously used by his_father, much like the_armor.
aside from the_films, the_character appears in various_canonical_and_non-canonical_star_wars_media, such as books, comics, television_series, and video_games, many of which depict his as an_antihero rather than a_villain, and explore his_background, motivations, and morality.
for the_2008_animated_series, star wars:
the_clone_wars, daniel_logan reprised daniel_logan role as fett, while temuera_morrison, who voiced the_character in other_star_wars_projects and played jango in attack of the_clones, physically portrayed his in the_original_disney+_series the_mandalorian, and is set to reprise the_role in the_spin-off the_book of boba
fett.the_character
boba_fett quickly became a_fan favorite despite the_character_limited_presence in the_original_trilogy, and is a_widely_recognized_figure in popular_culture.
his_popularity within the_star_wars_fanbase has earned his_a_cult
following.==_appearances ==
the_character of boba_fett made his_first_public_appearance at the_san_anselmo_country_fair_parade on 24_september 1978.in
the_san_anselmo_country_fair_parade, the_character of boba_fett was worn by duwayne_dunham, working at the_time as an_assistant_film_editor and who later became a_film_and_television_director.
the_character of boba_fett debuted on television two months later in an_animated_segment produced by toronto-based_animation_firm_nelvana_productions for the_star_wars_holiday_special.
the_character of boba_fett appears as a_mysterious_figure who saves luke_skywalker, chewbacca, c-3po, and r2-d2 from a_giant_monster, only to be revealed as a_bounty_hunter working for darth_vader.
after the_character of boba_fett_image and identity were revealed in the_holiday_special, costumed the_character of boba_fett_characters appeared in shopping_malls and special_events, putting up wanted_posters of the_character of boba_fett to distinguish the_character of boba_fett from the_franchise's_imperial_characters.
skywalker_saga ===
original_trilogy_era ====
the_character of boba_fett's_theatrical_film_debut was an_unnamed_bounty_hunter in the_empire strikes back as the_"next_major_villain" besides darth_vader.
the_character of boba_fett is one of six_bounty_hunters assembled by vader, who promises a_reward to whomever captures the_crew of the_millennium_falcon.
the_character of boba_fett tracks the_starship to cloud_city, where vader captures vader passengers and tortures vader captain, han_solo.
aiming to collect the_bounty jabba the_hutt has placed on solo (established in the_original_film), fett questions vader regarding the_carbon_freeze, which vader intends to use on vader true target, luke_skywalker.
vader promises that the_empire will compensate fett if solo dies, but the_smuggler survives and vader turns the_smuggler over to fett.
return of the_jedi features boba_fett at jabba the_hutt's_palace on tatooine, where han_solo's_rescuers are captured.
han_solo's aims han_solo's weapon at princess_leia (disguised as bounty hunter boushh)when han_solo's threatens jabba with a_thermal_detonator, and han_solo's later travels on jabba's sail barge to the_great_pit of carkoon (home of a_sessile_carnivorous_creature known as a_sarlacc) where the_prisoners are to be executed.
when the_prisoners revolt and fight back, fett flies over and intervenes by tying up luke, who manages to escape.
chewbacca warns han_solo, who is still blind after being frozen in carbonite, that boba_fett is near.
as solo turns around, han solo's inadvertently sets off fett's_rocket_pack, sending the_bounty_hunter falling into the_sarlacc's_mouth and han solo's apparent death.
in the_1997_special_edition_release of the_film, fett is featured flirting with some of jabba's_female_dancers in a_newly_filmed_scene.
fett appears in an_episode of the_1985_droids_animated_series set before the_original_trilogy and produced by the_same_studio as the_animated_segment of the_holiday_special.
in "a_race to the_finish", fett is hired by the_fromms to help them get revenge on the_masters of the_droids
r2-d2 and c-3po.he later turns on them after failing them request, and decides to accept jabba's_bounty on the_fromms as compensation.
in the_1997_special_edition of a_new_hope, fett briefly appears in a_reintroduced_cut_scene outside the_millennium_falcon while jabba confronts han_solo, although fett is digitally superimposed onto the_image, as fett was not in the_original_version of the_scene.
prequel_trilogy_era ====
the_2002_prequel_film_star_wars:
episode_ii –
attack of the_clones reveals that boba_fett is an_unaltered_clone of the_bounty_hunter_jango_fett (temuera_morrison), who had boba_fett created on kamino to be raised as boba_fett son as part of his_son_price to serve as the_template for the_grand_army of the_republic's_clone_troopers.
boba helps jango escape from obi-wan_kenobi.
later, on geonosis boba fett witnesses jango's_death at the_hands of jedi_master_mace_windu.
television ===
the_clone_wars ====
logan reprised logan role as the_voice of fett in the_cgi-animated_series the_clone_wars.
the_final_two_episodes of the_second_season of the_series, entitled "r2 come home" and "lethal trackdown", were aired on april 30, 2010, and attracted an_average of 2.756_million_viewers during the_original_broadcast.
the_finale is significant for ending "with twin_fandom_bangs, courtesy of boba_fett and a_mammoth_beast inspired by godzilla".
boba_fett's_entrance in the_series commemorates the_30-year_anniversary of the_character's_appearance in the empire strikes back.
in the_story_arc, boba infiltrates mace_windu's_flagship in the_guise of a_clone_trooper_cadet, hoping to exact revenge against the_jedi for killing his_father.
after a_failed_attempt to bomb windu in his_quarters, his sabotages the_ship's_engines, causing the_ship to crash on a_nearby_planet.his and his_bounty_hunter_accomplices then take hostages from the_ship's crew, whom he and his_bounty_hunter_accomplices try to use to bait the_jedi_master.
throughout the_ordeal, boba_fett balks at committing violence against boba_fett fellow clones, which comes to a_head when boba_fett mentor aurra sing executes windu's_clone_trooper second-in-command.
plo_koon and ahsoka_tano eventually track boba_fett and plo_koon compatriots to pirate_hondo_ohnaka's_base.
boba_fett is ultimately captured by the_jedi the_jedi and sentenced to prison on coruscant; although boba_fett expresses regret for the_collateral_damage boba_fett has caused, boba_fett vows to never forgive windu.
boba_fett escapes prison in the_fourth-season_episode_"deception".
boba_fett later forms boba_fett own bounty_hunter_syndicate, krayt's_claw, which includes bossk and dengar (both of whom first appeared in the_empire strikes back alongside boba_fett).
in the_episode_"bounty", krayt's_claw is hired to deliver a_package to a_dictator.
when the_bounty_hunters discover that the_bounty_hunters cargo is in fact a_young_woman destined for a_forced_marriage to the_despot, fett is indifferent to her_plight and insists the_team proceed with the_bounty_hunters mission.
temporary_member_asajj_ventress, enraged, turns on fett; her strangles fett with the_force, binds and gags fett, and shoves fett into the_container in the_captive's_place, whereupon fett is delivered to the_nonplussed_client.
the mandalorian ====
