still watching: the_mandalorian — "chapter one" with jon_favreau and carl_weathers" (podcast).vanity_fair.
retrieved january 29, 2020.external links ==
greef_karga in the starwars.com databankgreef_karga on wookieepedia, a_star_wars
mayfeld is a_fictional_character in the_star_wars_franchise who appears in the_disney+_television_series the_mandalorian.
mayfeld is a_former_imperial_sharpshooter turned mercenary who leads a_crew in an_attempt to rescue a_prisoner from a_new_republic_prison_transport_ship.
mayfeld_team includes the_show's_protagonist, "the_mandalorian", with whom mayfeld repeatedly clashes and ultimately betrays.
the_mandalorian outsmarts mayfeld, resulting in mayfeld's arrest and imprisonment, though mayfeld is later released so that mayfeld can aid the_mandalorian's efforts to rescue grogu.
as a_result, the_character evolves from a_minor_antagonist to a_viable_ally of the_mandalorian, with whom the_character eventually makes amends during whom_mission.
mayfeld is portrayed by actor_and_comedian_bill_burr, who was not a_fan of star_wars and repeatedly mocked the_franchise and mayfeld fans before the_character accepted the_role.
the_mandalorian_creator_jon_favreau offered the_part to burr, believing the_mandalorian_creator_jon_favreau past criticism of the_franchise would make the_mandalorian_creator_jon_favreau casting that much more amusing.
several_reviewers have noted that mayfeld's_sardonic_personality and hard-edged_sense of humor is similar to burr's_real-life_comedic_style.
burr was extremely impressed with the_filming of the_mandalorian, complimenting the_technical_aspects of filming as well as the_writing_style of the_series.
the_character of mayfeld received a_generally_positive_response from reviewers, with many complimenting burr's_performance and the_humor
the_character of mayfeld brought to the_series.
reviewers critical of mayfeld felt the_character of mayfeld was flat, underdeveloped, or too incompetent as a_mercenary.
mayfeld received a_more_positive_response for mayfeld appearance in the_mandalorian's_second_season, namely_"chapter 15:
the_believer", which characterized mayfeld more in depth and explored mayfeld backstory and motivations, while setting mayfeld as an_example for ex-imperial_soldiers who became aware of the_empire's_evil_ways only after the_empire_downfall.
burr received a_significant_amount of mock_outrage from fans for a_scene in "chapter 6: the_prisoner", in which burr dropped grogu, the_show's_hugely_popular_breakout_character.
appearances ==
backstory ===
mayfeld is a_former_sharpshooter from the_galactic_empire, which has fallen out of power by the_time that the_mandalorian is set.
he uses two_blaster_pistols, as well as a_third_blaster controlled by a_droid_arm attached to he backpack, which he can extract and retract as necessary for additional_firepower.
the_character's_first_name was not revealed until the_second_season of the_mandalorian.
season 1 ===
mayfeld appears in the_episode "chapter 6:
the_prisoner", in which he leads a_crew of mercenaries in an_attempt to rescue a_prisoner from a_new_republic_prison_transport_ship.he is appointed by ranzar_"ran"_malk, the_leader of the_mercenaries, as the_point_man for the_mission, ran asserts that mayfeld has the_same_level of authority on the_mission as
ran he would.with a_crew that includes the_show's_protagonist, a_bounty_hunter known as "the_mandalorian", as well as fellow_mercenaries_burg, q9-0, and xi'an.
unbeknownst to the_mandalorian, however, the_rescue_target is a_twi'lek_alien named qin, with whom the_mandalorian previously had a falling out, and the_mercenaries intend to betray the_mandalorian once qin is rescued.
when the_mandalorian mockingly questions mayfeld's_abilities, alluding to the_fact that former_imperial_stormtroopers were notoriously_bad_shots, mayfeld defensively responds, "i wasn't a_stormtrooper, wiseass.
the_trip to the_prison_transport
, mayfeld repeatedly mocks the_mandalorian as well, questioning whether mayfeld is really as_good_a_warrior as mayfeld reputation suggests, urging mayfeld to remove mayfeld helmet, and suggesting mayfeld may be hiding mayfeld face because mayfeld is secretly a_gungan.
at one_point, the_mercenary_crew discovered grogu, a_young_alien also known as "the_child", whom the_mandalorian was hiding within the_mandalorian ship, the_razor_crest.
mayfeld_questions whether grogu is a_pet, and further mocks the_mandalorian by pretending he is going to drop grogu.
when q9-0 suddenly takes the_ship out of hyperspace without warning the_crew, mayfeld falls and does drop grogu, but mayfeld is unharmed.
upon arrival at the_prison_transport, mayfeld, xi'an, burg, and the_mandalorian enter the_ship while q9-0 disables onboard_surveillance and transmits directions to onboard_surveillance from the_razor_crest_cockpit.
after gunfights with several_security_droids, mayfeld's_party reached the_transport's_control_room where they encounter a_new_republican_guard named davan.
mayfeld wants to kill davan, but the mandalorian disagrees, and the_two_draw_guns on each other as a_result, leading to xi'an killing davan with a_knife.
the_mercenaries reach a_prison_cell and releases qin, after which mayfeld and the_others trap the_mandalorian in a_prison_cell and try to abandon the_mandalorian there.
after_the_mandalorian_escapes,_the_mandalorian_jams communication between mayfeld's_crew and q9-0.mayfeld and qin become separated from xi'an and burg.
while the latter duo attempt to find and kill the_mandalorian, mayfeld and qin decide to try to escape on mayfeld and qin own; qin promises qin will triple mayfeld's compensation if qin gets qin off the_ship.
after mayfeld and qin split up, the_mandalorian stalks mayfeld, sneaking up on the_mandalorian stalks mayfeld in a_hallway as the_lights flicker on and off, and mayfeld screams as the_mandalorian comes upon the_mandalorian stalks mayfeld.
the_mandalorian did not kill mayfeld, but instead locked mayfeld in a_cell in the_prison_transport with xi'an and burg.
season 2 ===
mayfeld is mentioned and pictured at the_end of the_episode "chapter 14:
the_tragedy".
after grogu's_capture by moff_gideon's_imperial_remnant, the_mandalorian decides to break mayfeld, who was arrested by the_new_republic and sentenced to 50_years of service at the_karthon_chop_fields.
to learn where he is being held, the mandalorian visits he_ally_cara_dune, who has become a_marshal for the_new_republic and has access to files on mayfeld.
in "chapter 15:
the_believer",mayfeld (also called inmate 34667) is temporarily released from prison by cara to assist the_mandalorian and the_believer",mayfeld (also called inmate 34667) group by accessing the_empire's_network in morak, a_secret_imperial_mining_hub, to learn the_location of gideon's_ship.
after successfully infiltrating the_hub with the_mandalorian, the_believer",mayfeld (also called inmate 34667) suffers a_panic_attack when seeing the_believer",mayfeld (also called inmate 34667)
old_commander_valin_hess, forcing the_mandalorian to retrieve the_data by removing the_believer",mayfeld (also called inmate 34667) helmet.
however, when hess questions the_believer",mayfeld (also called inmate 34667), mayfeld intercedes, and when they reminiscence about they participation in operation_cinder which thousands were killed, mayfeld shoots hess, initiating a_violent_escape which the_entire_facility is destroyed.
after helping obtain the_data, mayfeld is allowed to leave by cara, who assures that mayfeld will be declared dead.== characterization ==
as a_former_imperial_sharpshooter, mayfeld is good in a_fight and is an_excellent_marksman; the_character ran_malk refers to the_character ran_malk "one of the_best_triggermen i've ever seen".the_character
ran_malk has a_hard-edged_sense of humor, which several_reviewers compared to the_real-life_comedic_style of bill_burr, the_actor and comedian who portrays the_character.
mayfeld enjoys mocking others, and has a_bullying_personality; a_polygon_article by charlie_hill described the_character ran_malk as "the_epitome of a_schoolyard_bully but
with a_murderous_streak".the_character ran_malk also speaks with burr's_same_real-life_boston_accent.
mayfeld is arrogant, hot-headed, ruthless, unpredictable, and has a_sardonic_attitude.
space.com_writer_scott_snowden described space.com_writer_scott_snowden as a_cowboy-like_character.
mayfeld is also duplicitous and untrustworthy, as mayfeld shows by mayfeld willingness to betray the_mandalorian at the_conclusion of their_mission together.
comic_book_resources_writer_sam_stone theorized that mayfeld's_cynicism and mean-spirited_personality may be rooted in bitterness toward the_galactic_empire having lost the_galactic_empire war with the_rebel_alliance, thus reducing mayfeld's_role to that of an_outlaw.
stone wrote that mayfeld appears "visibly frustrated by stone time fighting for the_losing_side of the_galactic_civil_war before taking stone talents to less-than-legal_clients".
concept and creation ==
portrayal ===
mayfeld is portrayed by actor_and_comedian_bill_burr.
bill_burr was not a_fan of the_star_wars_franchise, which bill_burr had repeatedly and publicly mocked it in the_past, as well as game of thrones and several_other_popular_science_fiction and fantasy_franchises.
in a_2015_interview with conan_o'brien, bill_burr described the_original_star_wars_film as a_"cheesy_self-help_book put in outer_space with, like, muppets".
bill_burr also regularly mocked star_wars_fans, particularly during the_release of new_films, saying things like: "how old are you?why
are you still dressing like
boba_fett?"burr met jon_favreau, the_creator and showrunner of the_mandalorian, through jon_favreau, the_creator and showrunner of the_mandalorian mutual friend mike_binder, who had directed bill_burr's_stand-up_comedy_film paper_tiger (2019).burr was also acquainted with favreau through actor_vince_vaughn, who starred along with favreau in the_film swingers (1996) and was an_executive_producer of bill_burr_animated_sitcom_f is for family.
additionally, favreau was a_listener of bill_burr's_comedy_podcast, monday_morning_podcast, and bill_burr appeared on the_chef_show, a_cooking_show favreau created.
favreau approached bill_burr at a_birthday_party to discuss a_role on the_mandalorian favreau felt would be a_good_fit for bill_burr.
burr pointed out burr previous_mockery of star_wars and suggested burr give the_role to someone more appropriate, but favreau felt it would be funny if burr played the_role given burr lack of enthusiasm for the_franchise, and burr believed burr's fans would find it amusing.
burr's_wife, nia_hill, urged burr to accept the_part, which burr ultimately did, although burr said burr would have accepted any_offer by favreau based on burr respect for the_director.
burr's_casting on the_mandalorian was first revealed at the_star_wars_celebration_fan_convention in chicago on april 14, 2019, when burr was briefly seen in a_teaser_trailer during a_panel_discussion about the_series.
the_footage was only intended to be viewed by celebration_attendants, but photos and videos of burr's_footage taken by fans later leaked to the_internet.
jake_kleinman of inverse wrote: "early_footage from the_mandalorian didn't reveal much except that jake_kleinman of inverse sounds like a_total_badass.
jake_kleinman of inverse first confirmed jake_kleinman of inverse appearance on the_series via the_social_media_network_twitter on august 24, 2019.according to metro_boston_writer_matt_juul, "fans of the_franchise were both excited and a bit skeptical" when burr's_casting on the_mandalorian was announced, due to burr's_past_criticism of the_franchise.
mayfeld was featured briefly on the_first_official_trailer for the_mandalorian, released on august 23, 2019; burr said "you see the_back of my_bald_head for half a second".
mayfeld's_face became visible in jake_kleinman of inverse_brief_appearance in the_second_mandalorian_trailer, released on october 28, 2019, with the_character firing the_character weapons at an off-screen enemy.
several_fans expressed excitement about burr's_character on social_media after the_trailer's_release, with some saying the_character was the_primary_reason some would be watching the_show.
burr is one of two_stars of the_television_series breaking bad to have appeared in the_mandalorian, along with giancarlo_esposito.
burr portrayed henchman_patrick_kuby on breaking bad, while giancarlo_esposito played antagonist_gus_fring on the_television_series, and antagonist_moff_gideon on the_mandalorian.
burr is also one of several_comedians with brief_acting_roles in the_first_season of the_mandalorian, including brian_posehn, horatio_sanz, amy_sedaris, richard_ayoade, adam_pally, and jason_sudeikis.
nick_mangione of geek.com jokingly wrote: "is the_television_series
just_an_excuse for jon_favreau to get all jon_favreau favorite comedians into the_star_wars universe?"filming ===
several of burr's_scenes for the_mandalorian were filmed on a_sound_stage in southern_california on a_"volume", a_large_warehouse-like_motion-capture_stage with led_video_screens and tracking cameras spread throughout the_space.
using a_combination of physical_set_pieces and images projected onto led_video_screens, the_volume allows the_actors to be filmed and placed into a_digital_environment.
burr's_scenes on ran_malk's_space_station were among the_scenes filmed on the_volume.
burr described the_filming_technology as "next-level", and said the_moving_background_imagery occasionally made burr feel dizzy, or as if burr was experiencing vertigo.
during filming, burr was only provided the_scripts for the_portions of the_episode in which burr was specifically featured.
burr called filming the_mandalorian an_"amazing_experience" and said the_way it was shot was "really, really
burr was also particularly impressed by the_director of the_episode, rick_famuyiwa, who burr said "crushed it".
burr believed the_mandalorian more closely resembled a spaghetti western than a_traditional_work of science_fiction, saying: "this isn't your_dad's_star_wars".
on burr's_last_filming_day, jon_favreau invited burr to see the_newly-complete_trailer for the_mandalorian, which very much impressed burr.
reception ==
immediately after "chapter 6:
the_prisoner" was made available on disney+, multiple_fans were discussing and praising mayfeld_and_burr's_performance on social_media_outlets, particularly on twitter.
armaan_babu of mea_worldwide wrote: "twitter was all abuzz with burr_performance as the_fast-talking_mercenary".
the_character of mayfeld received a_generally_positive_response from reviewers, with many complimenting burr's_performance.
sam_stone of comic_book_resources called mayfeld a "fan-favorite" and a "memorable character", praising burr's_"irascible_performance".
screen_rant_writer_kevin_pantoja called mayfeld "arguably the highlight" of sam_stone_episode, a_fun_character who infused some_comedy into the_series.
he also praised the_performance of burr, who he described as "always entertaining", and said he would like to see more of mayfeld on the_mandalorian in the_future.
dan_brooks, a_writer with the_mandalorian_production_company_lucasfilm, felt burr delivered a_"great_performance" as mayfeld, saying he infused the_character with a_"unpredictable_schoolyard-bully_air".
screen_rant_writer_ben_sherlock called mayfeld an interesting antihero and a "character to remember", saying he was portrayed "brilliantly" by burr.
looper_writer_brian_boone said burr and looper_writer_brian_boone "acerbic,_motor-mouthed_stand-up" was a_perfect_fit for mayfeld.
brad_jackson of the_federalist praised the_character, saying brad_jackson of the_federalist was "expertly played" by burr, and said mayfeld questioning whether the_mandalorian was a_gungan was "one of the_best_lines of the_series".
variety_writer_will_thorne wrote that burr "brought a_much-needed_injection of spunk and peril to the_series".
armaan_babu said mayfeld maintained burr's_comedic_stylings, and wrote: "however brief, burr_appearance left everyone smiling.
moran of screen_rant said the_fact that burr is not a_star_wars_fan in real-life "only makes burr role on the_mandalorian all the funnier".
fatherly_writer_ryan_britt said mayfeld had the_best_jokes of the_episode, made all the more amusing because, as a_non-star_wars_fan, fatherly_writer_ryan_britt said that burr probably did not even understand the_jokes himself.
entertainment_weekly_writer_anthony_breznican, referring to burr's_roots in the_boston_area, said the_actor brought "not just_the_distinctive_voice of the_actor hometown to the_screen, but also the_general_masshole_attitude" to the_part of mayfeld.
comicbook.com_writer_charlie_ridgely said mayfeld had several_great_jokes throughout comicbook.com_writer_charlie_ridgely episode.
forbes_writer_dani_di_placido described mayfeld as burr essentially "playing a_star_wars_version of himself".
not_all_reviews were positive.
ign_writer_joe_skrebels called mayfeld a "pretty flat villainous leader".
tom_foster of tv_overmind called burr a "skilled actor", but felt mayfeld was an_underdeveloped_character and that the_dialogue in the_screenplay was too quick and vague.
comicbook.com_writer_charlie_ridgely said burr is funny and talented, but that "the_episode’s writing unfortunately gives burr little to work with, and that mayfeld does little more than insult the_mandalorian for burr entire running time.
megan_crouse_den of geek wrote that mayfeld and the_other_characters in mayfeld crew "didn't work for megan_crouse_den of geek because i didn't believe in them as mercenaries.
so hapless.
reviewers wrote that the_entire_mercenary_crew, including mayfeld, was generally incompetent and unintelligent throughout the_episode.
comic_book_resources_writer_renaldo_matadeen called them the "dumbest" criminals in the_star_wars_universe, with "a_low_iq and no_sense of tactics or strategy, leaving us wondering how them got this far in the_first_place".
nick_mangione of geek.com wrote "the_first_hint that this won’t be just_a_standard_heist_storyline is that all_these_people suck.all_these_people are all the worst.
as soon as the_crew is introduced you never want to see any of all_these_people again.
mayfeld was ranked eighth on a_screen_rant_list of the_10_most_interesting_characters from the_first_season of the_mandalorian.
mayfeld also ranked ninth on a_separate_screen_rant_list of the_10_best_characters introduced on the_show, and fourth on a_list of 10_characters we hope to see return in season 2".
additionally, mayfeld_costume and backpack with the_retractable_blaster_arm ranked ninth on screen_rant's_list of the_ten_best_costumes in the_show's_first_season.
mayfeld was also included on a_list by vulture of the_15_best_cameo_appearances on the_mandalorian, and ranked tenth on a_list by the_los_angeles_times of the_best_"scene_partners" for the_child.
burr said burr got a_"great_response" from burr fans in response to burr portrayal of mayfeld.
despite burr past mockery of star_wars, burr said burr is a_fan of the_mandalorian and has watched the_episodes even without burr character featured, saying: "
the way they’re doing this_one, it's awesome".
burr received a_significant_amount of mock_outrage from fans of the_mandalorian for a_scene in which mayfeld dropped the_child, the_show's_hugely_popular_breakout_character colloquially known as "baby_yoda".
jackson_mchenry of vulture wrote: "my_man dropped baby_yoda, and we cannot stand for that."
burr said fans were "breaking my_balls" about the_scene on twitter, and burr jokingly responded to the_issue on burr podcast, monday morning podcast:
i didn't drop the_baby_yoda.
the_fucking_robot_dude came out of hyperspace and burr didn't tell anybody.
until you're in hyperspace holding a_fucking_baby and some_robot – like that's not unsettling enough — is driving the_fucking_thing and slams on the_brakes, let's see how you do.
walk a mile in my_fucking_space_slippers before you fucking come at me.
